result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M. Haley

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Offer deadline with DA is set for 09-23-22 at 8:30 am.   Scheduling conference is set for 11-09-22 at 9:15 a.m.   
Minutes.
Re:  Violate injunction restraining order, on 08-05-22.

$100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Jason Phelps, 5005 Thimbleberry Lane, Two Rivers, WI  54241.
Order to report TRPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of harassment temporary restraining order injunction.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-11-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, and defendant is to have no contact with S.J.F., DOB: 03-28-1991.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
